intro: Sclerochiton gilletii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps reduce water loss. Sclerochiton gilletii is also known for its medicinal properties, with various traditional uses reported in African herbal medicine.
